info.title: Ankai Jie
info.desc: Hi! My name is Ankai Jie. I am a second year student at the University of Waterloo studying computer science and statistics. This website, written with D3.js and Backbone.js, is meant to portray me in a graph format. Feel free to explore my profile! Click to see details and right click to expand.

info.title: Projects
info.desc: To see key projects that I have worked on over the years, expand this node. Each project will have a link to Github.

info.title: Academic Fraud Detector
info.desc: In academia, papers gain fame and credibility by the number of times they are cited by other papers. As with any other industry, there are people who try to cheat the system by colluding to inflate their citation count.  Fraudalyzer is a research project I worked on with the associate dean of graduate studies at the University of Waterloo that applies experimental data/graph processing algorithms on citation data between academic publishers, retrieved from Scopus. These algorithms are optimized to highlight fraudulent relationships and expose citation rings.

info.title: Hey Kanye!
info.desc: Hey Kanye is a custom made rap song generator. It takes bulk lyrical data from artists of any genre and applies statistical modelling to produce structurally accurate and meaningful music lyrics. It then syncs it to beats and uses text-to-speech to drop a sick new track.

info.title: Movie Queue
info.desc: MovieQueue is a web-based social application that allows users to create and build a queue of movies to watch in the future! Users can preview their friendsâ€™ movie profiles and see ratings, descriptions, and loads of other information for each movie.

info.title: Track Master
info.desc: Trackmaster is a web application that allows users to track selected other users. Trackers take on a list of subject and will receiver updated location information whenever subjects choose to check in. All accounts are stored in a database with an authentication system.

info.title: Work Experience
info.desc: I am interested in pursuing work in the data science, software, or quatitiative finance fields. To see a summary of the past places and positions I've worked, expand this node. To see my resume, click on the link below.

info.title: Data Science Engineer
info.desc: I worked on the Network Analytics team at Scotiabank. On this team I did a lot of analytical and data processing work in analyzing the bank's transactional data in a network (graph) view. I created a framework for processing temporal networks, implemented graph processing algorithms, and improved web functionality of our network visualizer.

info.title: Web Developer
info.desc: I worked on the creation of a new internal management web application for the company. I created a front end with AngularJS that permitted convenient and visually appealing access to the MySQL database. I built the Java pipeline from front to back end and conducted thorough testing.

info.title: Education
info.desc: I am pursuing a Bachelor of Computer Science at the University of Waterloo. I am planning to pursue the anticipated Data Science major and the business electives option for computer science students.

info.title: Software Engineer
info.desc: I worked on the Big Data team for The Meet Group. I worked on a scaleable and dynamic AWS automation system in Python, creating Hive UDF/UDAFs and ETLs for data analysis, and data visualization on the web.
